entry.title: Lawyers in Ukraine War-Crimes Trial Argue Over Russian Soldier's Intent
entry.content: The Russian tank sergeant who admitted killing a civilian isn’t guilty of intentional murder, his attorney said as the trial drew to a close, setting the stage for a verdict next week that will offer the first indication of how wartime justice could be meted out by Ukrainian courts.

entry.title: Ukrainian Families Risk Their Lives to Escape Russian Occupation
entry.content: Russian forces moved into the small town of Orikhiv, about 100 miles from Mariupol, soon after Moscow first ordered its invasion of Ukraine. The town’s residents faced explosions and shootings on a daily basis, forcing them to take the decision to leave.
